text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with roast quail with cured lemons

hopefully you saw that video and started

back and check that out and do it and
this came out so well so excited about

they're all dressed ready to use you can

on paper towel all right now you can
also soak these to really get the salt
out but I want to use that as sort of
the seasoning in the dish so just a

mix and to be honest I wanted to keep
this really simple because I really
wanted to taste what these lemons we're
gonna do so I'm gonna take one slice of
preserved lemon cured lemon and stick it
inside the cavity of each quail and then
I'm gonna trust it
now this hopefully doesn't look too
complicated you go under the breasts and
you tie it off in the back right by the

just kind of snag the two legs and give
it one more time
so let me show you this real quick again
so tie it around the breast and then
make one more loop in the back and just
kind of gather the two legs together and
just cinch it up
okay nothing fancy here in fact if you
want to use two pieces of string and
just tie the front and the back doesn't

Brown the quail on all sides and they
get a lot of sides so keep them moving

one slice of cured lemon over the breast
of each quail and what's going to happen
while this rose the saltiness and that
intense lemon flavor is going to kind of
permeate the outside and that lemon
slice we have on the inside
is gonna do the same thing so we got the
inside flavored we got the outside
flavored a little cayenne on there and
this is gonna go in a 425 degree oven
for between 10 and 15 minutes and I'll
explain that in the post also mine went
about 12 okay I'm gonna remove those
from the pan I'm gonna deglaze with some

get all that beautiful caramelized quail
juice off the bottom all right so I'm
gonna reduce that by half all right I'm
gonna taste this for salt and luckily it
needed some which let me mince up one of
those slices of cured lemon and add it
to the sauce I'm gonna put the quail
back in the pan and just reheat those
briefly by spooning over that hot jus or
pan sauce amazing I was so so excited
with how this came out the first thing
you get is kind of that bitterness of
the lemon that fades really quickly kind
of overwhelmed by the saltiness which
amazingly goes away really quickly and
then you're just left in your mouth with
this intense lemon flavor really really
interesting so it's like brief
bitterness then a brief salty hit and
then it kind of fades into this just
amazing
lemony experience now I said between 10
and 15 minutes for the quail see that
you want it to be a little pink around
the bone I mean it's hard to see you can
kind of see it here quail is usually not
cooked as much as something like a
chicken especially in a fancy restaurant
you're gonna get this thing it's gonna
be almost medium very pink around the
bone I kind of like to go just in
between that but anyway this came out so
juicy and perfect so I'm so happy we did
a batch those lemons I can't wait to use

really spectacular dish I hope you give
